content.description: Refer to Umpqua guide topo Y pp. 139. The most popular route on the Lower Wall. Climb to the right side of the cave then follow the seam to top-out on the Southwest Ledge. Walk-off
content.location: Refer to Umpqua guide Callahan's map pp. 66 and map 10 pp. 136. Right side of Fantasy Island west Lower Wall.

content.description: Steep fun short climb to access Lookingglass Crack, but tends to hold moss when not in use for long periods and requires a good brushing at the beginning of each season. Refer to Umpqua guide Topo Z, pp. 143.
content.location: East Wall of Fantasy Island. Refer to Umpqua Guide Callahan's map pp. 66 and map 10 pp. 136.

content.description: Very fun route but, because of its remote location relative to access this route has never received enough use to stay clean for long. Follow bolts up then right and around lower quality overhang to tie in with Outer Limits. Finish at ramp below Cosmos Wall or finish on Outer Limits (5.8). Because of its N aspect and tress shaddowing this route requires a fair amount of cleaning at the beginning of each season.
content.protection: bolts, walk-off onto Cosmos Ramp or Rappel from chains above Cosmos Wall.
content.location: Far right side of lower East Wall below Outer Limits.

content.description: P1: White Rabbit (5.10a) or Mad Hatter (5.8-). P2: climb the left facing, slightly overhung corner crack to the top belay bolts. Rappel off chains above Cosmos Wall.
content.protection: gear 1 to 5 inches, rappel chains above Cosmos Wall.
content.location: Refer to Umpqua guide Callahan's map pp. 66, map 10 pp. 136, and topo Z pp. 143.

content.description: Follow the left trending crack, just left of the "{hourglass") about 70 feet to the prominent belay ledge ("Southwest Ledge") above. Two bolts protect the bottom half of the climb.Â  Once you're over the lip (5.9), the last half is quality crack climbing (5.10a).
content.location: In the guide pp 144 this is identified to be on the east wall of Fantasy Island but is actually South facing. There is a ledge trail that will take you from the North saddle around the right side (looking down hill) to the downhill south side of the rock. Or, scramble to and rappel from the "Southwest Ledge".

content.description: Refer to Umpqua guide topo Z, pp.143. Climb up lower head wall left of large overhang, then straight up to the a large ledge with belay anchors. Rappel off of anchors, no chains. Top anchor to Rocket Man 5.10b are within easy access to right (facing the rock).
content.location: Refer to Umpqua guide map 10, pp. 136. Rappel from the SW ledge to the base of the South Wall or follow the scramble trail around the base of the lower wall to the base of the South Wall.

climbs.name: Rocket Man
climbs.fa: Greg Orton, Harold Hall, and Steve Miller 1995.

content.description: climb lower head wall to large ledge (5.7) from here you have the option of continuing straight up over steep slightly overhung rock to the large ledge and belay anchors above (5.10a/b) or deviating right and up to the same top anchors (5.8). Rappel off, no chains.
content.location: South Wall just right of Space Cowboy.

climbs.name: Outer Limits
climbs.fa: Greg Orton, Harold Hall, Steve Miller, and Nate Hart

content.description: From the first few moves of Cosmos, traverse left around the arete. The distinct crux comes half way up. Fun and exposed for such a short line.
follow bolts to belay anchors below the Looking-glass Crack and on top White Rabbit. Rappel from anchors, no chains or continue up Through the Lookingglass (5.8).
content.location: Next bolt line past small ridge around the corner from Rocket Man on East Wall. Bottom half of East Wall tends to hold moss if it goes unused for any length of time.

content.description: Refer to Umpqua guide topo X, pp. 137. Starts between Cosmos and Bonsai Crack following three bolts to the top. After 2nd bolt climb around left side of overhanging ledge and back to third bolt. Rappel of chains.
content.location: Right side of Cosmos wall between Cosmos and Bonsai Crack. Refer to Umpqua guide Callahans map, pp. 66. Map 10, pp. 136. Topo X, pp. 137.

content.description: Refer to Umpqua guide topo Y. Climbs the left ridge line to the madrone tree on the Southwest Ledge. Crux is last 15 feet. Can become mossy without use.
content.location: Refer to Callahans map pp. 66 and map 10 pp. 136. Far left edge of Fantasy Island's West Lower Wall

content.description: From the 2nd anchor of Spiritual Journey climb the left wall and around the corner out onto a large face using the narrow "catwalk". You will find the 2nd anchor for Dot to Dot at the "catwalk". Once around the corner follow bolts from hueco to hueco topping out on the Southwest Ledge. Walk-off. This route typically requires a good brushing at the beginning of each season.
content.location: Refer to Umpqua guide map 10, pp. 136. and topo Z, pp. 143. Rappel from Southwest Ledge down to the base of Spiritual Journey Crack where Dot to Dot climbs the wall left of the base of the crack.

content.description: Start at the end of the narrow ridge and make some tricky .8 moves. Use the holds on the arete and take in the view of the Cascade foothills to the west.
content.location: Cosmos is the bolted line just off to the right of the exposed arete. Belay on "The Ramp". The belay might want to clip into the fixed anchors on this narrow sandstone ridge.

content.description: Fun slightly overhanging climb with some challenging off-balance moves. Follow bolts to a large hueco,. From hueco angle left through crux move to summit. Rappel from chains above Cosmos Wall.
content.protection: bolts, rappel chains above Cosmos Wall.
content.location: On far corner right of Bonsai Crack and before the large belay ledge above the Lower West Wall. Refer to Umpqua Guide Topos X & Y.

content.description: Refer to Umpqua guide topo Y pp. 139. A short steep friction slab. Thinly protected and supplemented with clips to route on right. Typically climbed as a toprope. Can become mossy without use. Walk-off.
content.protection: bolts, top anchors without chains, walk-off
content.location: Refer to Umpqua guide Callahan's map pp. 66, map 10 pp. 136, and topo Y pp. 139. Center left of Fantasy Islands west Lower Wall.

content.description: Follows a short flared to off-width crack to a windswept tree on top Fantasy Island. Crack tends to build up moss without use. Place sling low on tree if needed for directional and belay from top anchors above Cosmos Wall, but do not belay off the tree itself. Rappel off Cosmos summit chains.
content.protection: gear to 5 inches.  Rappel chains on Cosmos Wall.
content.location: Short wide crack to the right side of Cosmos Wall.

content.description: Refer to Umpqua guide topo Y pp. 139. Fun slab climb up center right of the Lower Wall. Walk-off.
content.location: Refer to Umpqua guide Callahan's map pp. 66 and map 10 pp.136. Center right of Fantasy Island's west Lower Wall.

content.description: Fantasy Island is a beautiful little tower of rock that juts out from the top of  Reston Ridge. Because of the dramatic position of the spire, the somewhat short climbs have great exposure. The other rock formations of the Callahans can be seen in both directions from Fantasy Island. A great spot to watch raptors in flight above the steep forested hillside below.
